---
title: "Power BI for Accountants 2: Managing Budget Cycles"
---

## Description

This session is to equip accountants with strong Power BI foundations to effectively manage key tasks in budget cycles (e.g. variance analysis, custom budget reports, scalable KPI management). We will learn through hands-on projects with simulated budget ledger database. We will also cover best practices for data visualizations and dashboard design to enhance communication effectiveness, which can be easily overlooked. This session is a specialty Power BI lab that focuses on techniques beyong introductory level, so it is recommended for audience already understand the basics of Power BI.

## Length

8 hours.

## Key Takeaways

Upon completion of this course, you will understand:

- How to create and customize budget reports with Power BI
- How to leverage Power BI for productive variance anlaysis
- How to work with databases as a data source with Power BI
- Basics about relational database and why it matters to your Power BI projects
- How to choose the proper chart types to communicate different types of financial information
- Best practices in data visualizations and dashboard design
- Analytics engineering mindset and product management mindset and why they matter deeply to your Power BI projects


## Target Audience
This seminar appeals to several demographics: 

- **Analysts/staff accountants**, especially who 

  a. are tasked/interested in enhance budget reporting with Power BI and have access to ledger-level details as a data source, 

  b. want to advance skills in developing Power BI report products, or

  c. want to improve effectiveness of data visualization and dashboard desgins;

- **Managers**, especially who

  a. seek inspirations to improve team's budget management productivity with Power BI, 
  
  b. lead modernization projects in FP&A area (financial planning and analysis), 
  
  c. want to understand common best practices contribute to effective data visualization, or

  d. want to stay relevant with staff and colleagues about Power BI projects and effective data visualization techniques

## Prerequisite(s)

Basic understanding and hands-on expereinces of Microsoft Power BI is required.
